meanings.definition: Not able to be climbed or scaled.
meanings.sent1: The steep, unscalable mountain loomed before them, blocking their path.
meanings.sent2: The wall was so unscalable that even the most skilled climbers couldn't reach the top.
meanings.sent3: Trying to climb that unscalable tree would be like trying to reach the moon with a ladder.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of heights made the unscalable cliff seem like an insurmountable obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The unscalable fortress stood tall, daring anyone to try and conquer it.

meanings.definition: Not able to be overcome or surmounted.
meanings.sent1: The unscalable challenge of learning a new language seemed daunting at first.
meanings.sent2: The unscalable barrier of language differences made communication difficult.
meanings.sent3: His stubbornness was as unscalable as a wall, making compromise impossible.
meanings.sent4: The unscalable problem at work required a creative solution to overcome.
meanings.sent5: The unscalable task of organizing the event felt overwhelming, but she tackled it one step at a time.
